content: The boolean NOT operator ("!") inverts the value of a boolean expression.  The boolean AND operator ("&&") will result in true if and only if the values on both sides of the operator are true.  The boolean inclusive OR operator ("||") will result in true if either or both of the values on the sides of the operator is true.  The boolean exclusive XOR operator ("^") will result in true if one and only of the values on the sides of the operator is true.
